newsitem.title: USA: Cincinnati Milacron sees Q4 sales growth.
newsitem.headline: Cincinnati Milacron sees Q4 sales growth.

text.p: Cincinnati Milacron Inc said on Tuesday that it expected consolidated sales, orders and earnings to increase in the fourth quarter, compared to the same period, as gains in plastic machinery and machine tools offset current slowness in industrial products.

"As for 1997, we expect even better results in each of our segments," said Daniel Meyer, chairman and chief executive. "Longer term, Milacron is very well positioned to benefit from the eventual recovery in Europe and, barring unforeseen recessions, to achieve sustained growth for the rest of the 1990s."

The company, which reported third quarter earnings of $0.47 per share against $0.46 per share in the same quarter last year, said earnings increased despite a downturn in plastics machinery in the first half and continued soft demand in Europe affecting all of its businesses.
"Each of our three groups made good progress in the quarter," Meyer said.
Plastics machinery rebounded from a 12-month downturn, after a pickup in the North American injection molding machines market, the company said.

Machine tools booked significant new business with encouraging increased demand from the aerospace industry, Meyer said, and the company's largest segment, industrial consumable products, continued to improve earnings.
